lead_paragraph: Showers of high-energy particles from cosmic rays had different radio emissions depending on the weather, possibly providing a way to measure a thunderhead.’

headline.print_headline: Astronomy: Stars’ Rays May Help Measure Thunderstorms
headline.main: Rays From Exploding Stars May Help Measure Strength of Thunderstorms

snippet: Showers of high-energy particles from cosmic rays had different radio emissions depending on the weather, possibly providing a way to measure a thunderhead.’
abstract: Study published in journal Physical Review Letters reports finding safer method for measuring electric fields in thunderclouds, which can help define power of a thunderstorm; researchers in Netherlands used radio telescopes to measure high-energy particles generated by exploding stars, which vary markedly during fair weather and thunderstorms.
